Braccio Robotico 5 Assi WIP

Prototype development log — cycloidal drive experiments, mechanics and motion tests.

1) Concept & Goal

This is the first concept sketch showing what I want the final 5-axis robotic arm to become. The goal is a compact, modular structure with a strong focus on cycloidal drives and reliable motion.

2) Cycloidal Drive Iterations

Here you can see the different cycloidal prototypes I printed. I iterated on geometry, tolerances and assembly until I found a solution that felt smooth, strong and “print-friendly”. (Add here what changed between versions: bearing seats, clearances, pin count, materials, etc.)

3) Cycloidal Movement Test

Close-up test showing only the cycloidal movement. This helped me confirm smoothness, backlash and stability.

4) Current State: Shoulder & Elbow

This is where the project is now: shoulder and elbow assembled and tested. Next steps are improving rigidity, cable routing and preparing the other joints.

5) Motion Test

Full motion test video. This is useful to evaluate joint smoothness, alignment and any mechanical flex.

6) Design Sketches

Sketch of the full assembly of the arm (layout, joints, proportions).

Sketch explaining how the cycloidal driver assembly is built and how the components fit together.
